top_symptoms.symptom: feeling of losing control or dread

primary_symptoms: recurrent unexpected panic attacks (sudden intense fear)
shortness of breath or smothering sensation
immediate_advice: If experiencing a panic attack, sit or lie down and practice slow diaphragmatic breathing (4-4-8 technique)
Move to a safe, calm environment and focus on grounding (name 5 things you can see)
Avoid stimulants (caffeine, nicotine) until symptoms settle
quick_solutions: Practice regular breathing exercises and mindfulness
Maintain regular sleep and reduced caffeine intake
Keep a symptom diary to identify triggers
Consider contacting a mental health professional for assessment
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent help if you have chest pain that is new/severe, fainting, or symptoms that suggest a heart attack; otherwise consult a physician or psychiatrist if panic attacks are recurrent or impairing.

primary_symptoms: sensation of a lump in the throat
immediate_advice: Rest your voice and avoid whispering or shouting
Use humidified air to reduce throat dryness
quick_solutions: Voice therapy with a speech-language pathologist
Reduce vocal strain and treat reflux if present
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See an ENT (ear, nose & throat) specialist if hoarseness persists for more than 2 weeks or voice changes are progressive.

primary_symptoms: symptoms depend on the specific rare disease (may be multisystem)
progressive functional impairment in some cases
immediate_advice: Record a detailed history and timeline of symptoms
Avoid assumptions — seek specialist referral for evaluation
Bring family history information and past records to appointments
quick_solutions: Obtain comprehensive evaluation with appropriate specialist(s)
Consider referral to a tertiary or rare-disease center
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek specialist/tertiary care when symptoms are unexplained, progressive, or disabling.

immediate_advice: If ingestion is suspected, call local emergency services or poison control immediately
Do not induce vomiting unless instructed by medical professionals
If available and within minutes of ingestion, activated charcoal is NOT effective for ethylene glycol; seek emergency care
quick_solutions: Rapid transport to emergency department for evaluation
Hospital evaluation may include blood gas, electrolytes, osmolar gap, and toxicology tests
Antidotes (fomepizole or ethanol) and supportive care may be required
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent emergency care immediately for suspected ingestion — this can be life-threatening.

primary_symptoms: vaginal dryness and thinning of tissues
vaginal bleeding or spotting in postmenopausal women
immediate_advice: Use non-irritating, fragrance-free lubricants for intercourse
Maintain gentle hygiene and avoid harsh soaps
quick_solutions: Topical vaginal estrogen (under specialist guidance) is effective for many postmenopausal patients
Regular sexual activity or use of vaginal moisturizers may help
Discuss treatment options with a gynecologist
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See a gynecologist if symptoms are persistent, severe, or if there is unexplained bleeding.

top_symptoms.symptom: deformity or inability to move fingers
numbness or tingling if nerve involvement

primary_symptoms: acute localized pain after an injury
reduced range of motion or inability to use the hand
immediate_advice: Immobilize the hand with a splint and apply ice to reduce swelling
Elevate the hand and avoid using it
Seek radiographic evaluation (X-ray) at emergency or urgent care
quick_solutions: Follow-up with orthopedic or hand specialist for possible casting, splinting, or surgery
Pain control with oral analgesics as advised
Physical therapy after healing to restore function
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent evaluation if severe deformity, open wound, inability to move fingers, or signs of compromised circulation.

primary_symptoms: localized painful swelling of gums, cheek, or oral tissues
immediate_advice: If airway compromise or breathing difficulty is present, seek emergency care immediately
Rinse mouth with warm saline; avoid deep probing or attempting to lance yourself
Seek urgent dental or medical evaluation
quick_solutions: Dental drainage or surgical incision may be required by a dentist/oral surgeon
Antibiotic therapy prescribed by a clinician if bacterial infection is suspected
Maintain oral hygiene and follow-up care
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent care or emergency department if increasing swelling, fever, difficulty breathing, or trismus.
medical_advice.specialist_recommendation: Dentist / Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeon / ENT

primary_symptoms: visible misalignment of one or both eyes (strabismus)
immediate_advice: If sudden onset of double vision or drooping eyelid occurs, seek emergency evaluation (possible neurological cause)
Avoid activities requiring precise depth perception until evaluated
quick_solutions: Assessment by ophthalmologist or orthoptist for diagnosis
Corrective lenses, prisms, vision therapy, or surgical correction depending on cause
Address underlying causes (thyroid eye disease, nerve palsy) as needed
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent ophthalmology or emergency care for sudden diplopia, associated neurological symptoms, or trauma.

primary_symptoms: positional headache that worsens when sitting or standing and improves when lying down
nausea and sensitivity to light in some cases
immediate_advice: Lie flat and hydrate orally; caffeine (under clinician advice) may provide temporary relief
Avoid strenuous activity and heavy lifting
Contact the performing clinician for advice if headache is severe or persistent
quick_solutions: Conservative measures: fluids, bed rest, oral caffeine
If persistent >48 hours and severe, epidural blood patch may be offered by anesthesiology/neurosurgery
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek prompt medical attention if severe constant headache, signs of infection, or neurologic deficits occur.

top_symptoms.symptom: weight loss or poor weight gain

primary_symptoms: forceful projectile vomiting in infants (usually 2–8 weeks old)
poor weight gain and signs of dehydration
palpable epigastric mass in some cases
immediate_advice: Seek urgent pediatric evaluation if an infant has repeated projectile vomiting or signs of dehydration
Do not attempt home remedies; fluid resuscitation may be necessary
quick_solutions: Surgical correction (pyloromyotomy) is usually required after stabilization
Prompt rehydration and electrolyte correction in hospital
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate medical attention for infants with projectile vomiting, lethargy, decreased urine output, or poor feeding.

top_symptoms.symptom: swelling near jaw or under the ear

primary_symptoms: swelling of a salivary gland (parotid, submandibular)
pain or discomfort, often worse with eating
dry mouth or decreased saliva flow
immediate_advice: Hydrate well and massage the gland; sialogogues (lemon drops) may stimulate saliva
Seek medical/dental evaluation if swelling is persistent or painful
quick_solutions: If obstructive (stone), ENT/dental procedures may be needed
Antibiotics if bacterial infection is suspected
Manage chronic causes (sjogren syndrome) with specialist care
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent care if increasing swelling, high fever, or breathing difficulty; otherwise see ENT/dentist for persistent symptoms.

top_symptoms.symptom: stiffness or limited range of motion

primary_symptoms: chronic localized pain in affected bone/joint area
worse with activity in many cases
immediate_advice: Rest the affected joint and avoid aggravating activities
Apply ice for acute pain and consider over-the-counter analgesics as appropriate
quick_solutions: Orthopedic assessment; physiotherapy and activity modification
Surgical options for severe or refractory cases in select conditions
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See orthopedic specialist if persistent pain, progressive deformity, or functional impairment.

primary_symptoms: pain, swelling, or instability following trauma or twisting
immediate_advice: RICE: rest, ice, compression, elevation; avoid weight-bearing if severe
Immobilize with brace/splint and seek clinical assessment
quick_solutions: Orthopedic or sports medicine evaluation including imaging (X-ray, MRI if ligament/cartilage injury suspected)
Physiotherapy and gradual rehabilitation; surgery for severe ligament tears or fractures
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent assessment for inability to bear weight, gross deformity, or suspected fracture; otherwise prompt outpatient evaluation.

primary_symptoms: varied symptoms depending on specific metabolic condition (fatigue, weight change, growth issues, electrolyte imbalance)
immediate_advice: If severe symptoms (confusion, severe dehydration, hypoglycemia) occur, seek emergency care
Collect prior laboratory results and medication history for evaluation
quick_solutions: Refer to endocrinology/metabolic specialist for targeted testing (metabolic panels, genetic tests)
Manage acute metabolic derangements in hospital as needed
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for signs of metabolic crisis (severe dehydration, altered sensorium, hypoglycemia/hyperglycemia).

primary_symptoms: vaginal itching, burning, or abnormal discharge
possible odor and discomfort with urination or intercourse
immediate_advice: Avoid douching and scented products; use gentle hygiene
Avoid sexual intercourse until evaluated if symptomatic
quick_solutions: See a clinician for evaluation to distinguish yeast, bacterial vaginosis, trichomonas, or atrophic causes
Treatments vary: topical/oral antifungals for yeast, antibiotics for bacterial causes
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical evaluation if severe pain, fever, or persistent symptoms despite over-the-counter measures.

top_symptoms.symptom: episodes of alternating bradycardia and tachycardia

primary_symptoms: symptoms related to abnormal sinus node function: slow heart rate, bradycardia, syncope, dizziness, palpitations
immediate_advice: If fainting or severe lightheadedness occurs, seek emergency care
Avoid medications that can worsen bradycardia unless directed by a cardiologist
quick_solutions: Cardiology assessment including ECG and ambulatory monitoring (Holter/event monitor)
Pacemaker implantation may be recommended for symptomatic bradyarrhythmia
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent evaluation for syncope, recurrent presyncope, or signs of hemodynamic instability.

top_symptoms.symptom: worsening with stress or noise exposure

primary_symptoms: perception of sound (ringing, buzzing) without external source
may be constant or intermittent and can affect concentration and sleep
immediate_advice: Avoid loud noise exposure and ototoxic medications if possible
Use masking sounds (white noise) at bedtime to aid sleep
quick_solutions: Treat underlying causes if identified (hearing loss, earwax, infection)
Cognitive sound therapy, counseling, or hearing aids if indicated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See ENT/audiology if tinnitus is sudden, unilateral, or associated with hearing loss or neurological symptoms.

top_symptoms.symptom: eye pain and headache (in acute angle-closure)
gradual central vision loss in advanced disease

primary_symptoms: often asymptomatic early with progressive peripheral vision loss
possible severe eye pain, redness, and visual halos in acute angle-closure glaucoma
immediate_advice: If sudden severe eye pain, nausea, and visual changes occur, seek emergency ophthalmic care
Regular eye screening if at risk (family history, elevated IOP, diabetes)
quick_solutions: Topical intraocular pressure-lowering medications prescribed by ophthalmologist
Laser or surgical procedures for certain types of glaucoma
Regular ophthalmology follow-up and visual field monitoring
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Emergency if acute painful vision change; routine ophthalmology for chronic disease management.

primary_symptoms: restrictive eating, binge eating, or compensatory behaviors (vomiting, laxative use)
weight changes, preoccupation with food and body image, functional impairment
immediate_advice: If severe malnutrition, fainting, or dangerous electrolyte disturbance suspected, seek emergency care
If patient safety is a concern, contact emergency services or crisis line
quick_solutions: Multidisciplinary treatment: medical stabilization, nutritional rehabilitation, psychotherapy (CBT, family-based)
Referral to specialized eating disorder services
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent medical care for syncope, severe electrolyte imbalance, dehydration, or cardiac symptoms; otherwise prompt specialist referral.

top_symptoms.symptom: sudden focal neurologic deficit (weakness on one side)
symptoms resolve within minutes to hours

primary_symptoms: sudden transient neurological deficits such as unilateral weakness, speech disturbance, or visual loss that resolve within 24 hours (typically shorter)
immediate_advice: Treat as a medical emergency — call emergency services immediately when symptoms occur (stroke/TIA protocol)
Do not wait for symptoms to fully resolve before seeking care
quick_solutions: Urgent imaging (CT/MRI), vascular and cardiac evaluation in specialized stroke/TIA service
Secondary prevention measures: antiplatelet/anticoagulation, blood pressure control, cholesterol management as advised
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency evaluation for suspected TIA/stroke.

immediate_advice: Seek medical care promptly — antibiotics are required
If severe (fever >39°C, vomiting, confusion), seek emergency care
quick_solutions: Course of oral or IV antibiotics depending on severity
Follow-up urine cultures and imaging if recurrent
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate evaluation if fever, flank pain, or systemic illness — untreated pyelonephritis can progress to sepsis.

primary_symptoms: weakness or loss of shoulder function
immediate_advice: Rest shoulder and avoid heavy lifting
Use a supportive sling if needed temporarily
quick_solutions: Surgical repair for large tears or persistent disability
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Consult orthopedic doctor if pain >2 weeks, significant weakness, or inability to lift arm.

primary_symptoms: pain lasting more than 3 months without clear ongoing tissue damage
associated fatigue, sleep issues, and low mood
immediate_advice: Avoid overuse of opioids unless prescribed
Use heat/cold packs for symptom relief
Engage in gentle physical activity rather than prolonged rest
quick_solutions: Multidisciplinary approach: pain medicine, physiotherapy, psychology
Non-opioid medications as guided by pain specialist
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek specialist evaluation if pain interferes with daily life or if mood symptoms worsen.

primary_symptoms: bleeding, abdominal pain, swelling, high blood pressure, or reduced fetal movement depending on condition
immediate_advice: Seek immediate obstetric evaluation if bleeding, severe pain, or reduced fetal movement
Monitor blood pressure if hypertensive disorders suspected
quick_solutions: Prompt obstetric review and ultrasound assessment
Hospital management if complications like preeclampsia, miscarriage, or placental issues are suspected
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediately if heavy bleeding, severe abdominal pain, or absent fetal movements.

immediate_advice: Seek medical evaluation if unexplained jaundice, weight loss, or abdominal swelling
quick_solutions: Treatment options include surgery, ablation, transplant, chemotherapy, or targeted therapy
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent specialist consultation if liver cancer is suspected.

immediate_advice: Seek medical care if symptoms severe or post-surgical
quick_solutions: Treat underlying cause (mucus plug, tumor, pleural effusion)
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent evaluation if sudden breathlessness or low oxygen.

immediate_advice: Seek urgent care for severe pain, deformity, or loss of function
quick_solutions: Splint/cast or surgical repair if severe
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate care if open wounds, deformity, or inability to move hand.

primary_symptoms: abdominal pain in right upper quadrant
immediate_advice: Seek urgent hospital care for abdominal pain with jaundice/fever
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate evaluation if jaundice with pain and fever (possible cholangitis).

primary_symptoms: inability to walk or bear weight
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent hospital care for hip trauma with inability to walk.

immediate_advice: Seek urgent care if confusion, vomiting blood, or severe swelling
quick_solutions: Diuretics for ascites, lactulose for encephalopathy
Consider liver transplant evaluation in advanced disease
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency if vomiting blood, altered mental state, or severe swelling.

primary_symptoms: often silent; chest/back pain if symptomatic
immediate_advice: If sudden severe chest/back pain occurs, call emergency services immediately
Control blood pressure strictly if known aneurysm
quick_solutions: Regular imaging follow-up if stable aneurysm
Surgical repair for large or symptomatic aneurysm
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Emergency for sudden severe pain or collapse; routine vascular follow-up otherwise.

primary_symptoms: headache and confusion after head trauma
seizures or coma in severe cases
immediate_advice: Seek emergency evaluation after any head injury with neurological symptoms
quick_solutions: Close monitoring for small, stable bleeds
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency if neurological symptoms develop after trauma.

immediate_advice: Diabetic patients should have annual eye exams
Seek prompt ophthalmology care if vision suddenly worsens
quick_solutions: Tight blood sugar, blood pressure, and cholesterol control
Laser therapy or injections for advanced disease
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate evaluation for sudden vision changes; routine screening otherwise.

quick_solutions: Medications like pregabalin or duloxetine may help
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek rheumatology evaluation for persistent widespread pain.

primary_symptoms: sudden severe abdominal pain out of proportion to findings
immediate_advice: Seek emergency care immediately for sudden severe abdominal pain
Do not eat or drink until evaluated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Emergency for any suspected bowel ischemia.

immediate_advice: Avoid alcohol during pregnancy to prevent condition
If suspected, early pediatric and developmental evaluation is crucial
quick_solutions: Early intervention programs and educational support
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek pediatric evaluation if developmental delay or features consistent with FAS are suspected.

immediate_advice: Do not eat or drink until evaluated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency care for severe abdominal pain with rigidity and fever.

primary_symptoms: bruising, possible shock or internal bleeding
immediate_advice: Call emergency services immediately after abdominal trauma
Immobilize patient and do not give food/drink
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency care for any abdominal trauma with pain or instability.

top_symptoms.symptom: severe epigastric pain radiating to back

primary_symptoms: sudden severe abdominal pain radiating to back
immediate_advice: Seek emergency care for severe abdominal pain
Do not eat or drink until evaluated
quick_solutions: Hospitalization with IV fluids, pain relief, supportive care
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency evaluation for acute severe abdominal pain.

primary_symptoms: pain, redness, swelling along a vein
immediate_advice: Seek medical care for evaluation of DVT risk
quick_solutions: Anticoagulation if deep vein thrombosis suspected
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent evaluation if leg swelling, pain, or suspicion of DVT.
Immediate emergency for any suspected case — delay can cause blindness.

immediate_advice: Seek medical care for fever with cough and breathlessness
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate hospital care if breathless or oxygen low.

primary_symptoms: temporary confusion or loss of awareness
immediate_advice: Ensure patient safety during seizure (side-lying, clear environment)
Do not put objects in mouth
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Emergency if seizure lasts >5 minutes or multiple seizures without recovery.

quick_solutions: Most acute cases are viral, supportive care
Chronic cases require bronchodilators and inhalers
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if cough >3 weeks, breathlessness, or fever.

immediate_advice: Avoid spicy, acidic foods and alcohol
quick_solutions: Proton pump inhibitors for acid suppression
Test and treat H. pylori if present
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical help if persistent pain, vomiting blood, or black stools.

primary_symptoms: swollen, red tonsils sometimes with pus
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek care if difficulty breathing, swallowing, or recurrent infections.

immediate_advice: Seek gastroenterology evaluation if blood in stool or persistent bowel habit changes
Do not ignore weight loss with anemia
quick_solutions: Surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation depending on stage
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediately if blood in stool or unexplained weight loss.

primary_symptoms: loss of appetite and weight loss
immediate_advice: Seek immediate care if vomiting blood or black stools
Get evaluated for persistent dyspepsia with weight loss
quick_solutions: Surgery, chemotherapy, targeted therapy depending on stage
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate hospital visit if bleeding; prompt evaluation if chronic symptoms.

immediate_advice: Early intervention and evaluation are critical
Involve parents in structured educational support
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek pediatric evaluation as soon as delays are noticed.

primary_symptoms: sudden anxiety and fear after traumatic event
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist beyond a month (possible PTSD), seek psychiatric care.

immediate_advice: Identify and treat underlying medical cause
quick_solutions: Correct electrolyte imbalance, infection, or drug side effects
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent medical evaluation for any sudden confusion.

primary_symptoms: thickened, hard skin patches on feet or hands
quick_solutions: Use pumice stone to remove thick skin
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If painful, infected, or recurrent despite care.

immediate_advice: Seek emergency care for rapidly progressive weakness
quick_solutions: ICU support for respiratory failure risk
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency for sudden weakness/numbness.

immediate_advice: Rest for short periods, avoid prolonged bed rest
Use heat therapy and pain relief
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek evaluation if pain persists >6 weeks or with weakness/numbness.

immediate_advice: Use saline nasal sprays for relief
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek ENT evaluation if recurrent sinus infections or severe obstruction.

primary_symptoms: raised red vascular lesion typically appearing in infancy
rapid growth phase followed by gradual involution
immediate_advice: Avoid trauma to the lesion to prevent bleeding or ulceration
Keep lesion clean and covered if ulcerated
quick_solutions: Beta-blocker therapy (oral propranolol) or topical therapy for problematic lesions
Referral to pediatric dermatology or vascular anomalies clinic for complicated cases
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek specialist care if ulceration, bleeding, impairment (eye/airway), or rapid growth occurs.

primary_symptoms: pain in legs on walking relieved by rest (intermittent claudication)
coolness, pallor, or non-healing ulcers in severe disease
immediate_advice: Stop smoking and avoid prolonged immobility
Rest when claudication occurs and avoid overexertion
quick_solutions: Exercise program, smoking cessation, antiplatelet therapy, and risk-factor control
Revascularization (angioplasty or bypass) for critical limb ischemia
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek vascular specialist if rest pain, non-healing wounds, or limb-threatening ischemia develops.

primary_symptoms: persistent low back pain lasting months with periods of worsening
immediate_advice: Avoid prolonged bed rest; keep active within pain limits
Simple analgesics and heat/ice for symptom relief
quick_solutions: Consider multidisciplinary pain management if refractory
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek care if progressive weakness, bowel/bladder dysfunction, or severe unremitting pain.

top_symptoms.symptom: orthopnea/PND (waking at night short of breath)

primary_symptoms: breathlessness, fatigue, fluid retention (leg swelling), orthopnea
immediate_advice: Seek urgent care for sudden worsening breathlessness, chest pain, or fainting
Limit salt intake and monitor weight daily
quick_solutions: Optimize medications (ACE inhibitors/ARBs, beta-blockers, diuretics) under cardiology guidance
Fluid management and lifestyle modification; consider device therapy in select patients
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate care for severe dyspnea, hypotension, or syncope.

primary_symptoms: red, irritated eyes with discharge or watering and possible itching
immediate_advice: Practice hand hygiene and avoid touching eyes
Use clean compresses to remove crusting
quick_solutions: Viral — supportive care; bacterial — topical antibiotics if purulent
Allergic — topical antihistamines and avoidance of trigger
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek care if severe pain, vision loss, photophobia, or if symptoms worsen.

primary_symptoms: localized back pain with radiating limb pain, numbness, or weakness
immediate_advice: Avoid heavy lifting and activities that worsen pain
quick_solutions: Epidural steroid injection for select patients
Surgical decompression for progressive weakness or cauda equina
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for bowel/bladder dysfunction or progressive neurological deficit.

primary_symptoms: severe muscle pain, weakness, and dark urine indicative of muscle breakdown
immediate_advice: Seek urgent medical evaluation and blood tests if dark urine or severe muscle pain after exertion or trauma
Hydrate aggressively as advised by clinicians
quick_solutions: Intravenous fluids to prevent/treat acute kidney injury
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency care for dark urine, decreased urine output, or severe systemic symptoms.

primary_symptoms: breast pain, localized redness, swelling often with systemic symptoms in infection
immediate_advice: Continue breastfeeding/pumping if possible and apply warm compresses
Seek medical advice for antibiotics if infection suspected
quick_solutions: Antibiotics for bacterial mastitis; drainage for abscess if present
Lactation consultant support for breastfeeding technique
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if high fever, severe pain, or suspected abscess.

primary_symptoms: frequently asymptomatic; may present with abdominal/back pain or pulsatile mass
immediate_advice: Seek emergency care for sudden severe abdominal or back pain with collapse
Screening recommended in at-risk populations (older males, smokers)
quick_solutions: Ultrasound/CT for diagnosis and vascular surgical assessment
Surgical/endovascular repair for large or symptomatic aneurysms
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Emergency for suspected rupture or acute severe pain.

primary_symptoms: sudden dyspnea, pleuritic chest pain, rapid heartbeat; sometimes hemoptysis or collapse
immediate_advice: Call emergency services immediately for sudden severe breathlessness or collapse
Avoid prolonged immobility and seek evaluation for DVT risk
quick_solutions: Anticoagulation therapy; thrombolysis in massive PE; thrombectomy in select cases
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency care for suspected PE.

top_symptoms.symptom: violation of rules or rights of others

primary_symptoms: repetitive pattern of behavior violating others' rights or major societal norms (aggression, theft, rule-breaking)
immediate_advice: Ensure safety of the child and others; seek professional help
Provide structure and clear behavioral expectations
quick_solutions: Behavioral therapy, family interventions, school-based programs
Referral to child/adolescent psychiatrist for comprehensive management
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek mental health services if behavior is severe or escalating.

primary_symptoms: postoperative pain, wound changes, limited mobility, possible lymphedema
immediate_advice: Follow wound care instructions and pain management as prescribed
Report fever, increasing redness, or drainage
quick_solutions: Oncology follow-up for adjuvant therapy as indicated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for wound infection signs or severe complications.

top_symptoms.symptom: sudden gush or leakage of fluid

primary_symptoms: sudden leakage of amniotic fluid before labor onset
immediate_advice: Seek immediate obstetric evaluation if membranes rupture
Avoid vaginal exams and sexual intercourse until evaluated
quick_solutions: Assess gestational age, monitor for infection, and plan management (expectant, induction, or delivery) accordingly
Antibiotics and corticosteroids may be used depending on gestational age
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate obstetric care after suspected membrane rupture.

primary_symptoms: abnormal bleeding, pelvic pain, abnormal discharge, or abnormal screening results
immediate_advice: Seek gynecological evaluation for abnormal bleeding or discharge
Avoid intercourse if bleeding or discharge is concerning
quick_solutions: Diagnosis with speculum exam, HPV testing, Pap smear, and colposcopy if indicated
Treat infections or proceed with management for dysplasia/cancer as advised
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Prompt gynecologic follow-up for abnormal bleeding or positive screening tests.

primary_symptoms: hoarseness, reduced voice volume, throat irritation
quick_solutions: Most cases viral and self-limited; treat reflux or irritants if contributory
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent consult if breathing difficulty or stridor occurs.

top_symptoms.symptom: weeping or crusting in severe cases

primary_symptoms: recurrent small, intensely itchy blisters on palms and/or soles
immediate_advice: Avoid irritants and excessive hand washing; use emollients
quick_solutions: Topical corticosteroids for acute flares; identify and avoid triggers
Consider patch testing if allergic contact suspected
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See dermatologist if severe, recurrent, or infected lesions.

primary_symptoms: slow or shallow breathing, decreased responsiveness, pinpoint pupils
immediate_advice: Call emergency services immediately for suspected overdose
Administer naloxone if available and trained to use
quick_solutions: Support airway and breathing; naloxone in hospital or by first responders
Observation and addiction treatment referral after stabilization
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency care for any signs of overdose.

top_symptoms.symptom: red, irritated skin in diaper area
cracked or weeping skin in severe cases

primary_symptoms: red, irritated skin in the diaper area, sometimes with satellite papules in fungal cases
immediate_advice: Change diapers frequently and allow air exposure
Use barrier creams (zinc oxide) and gentle cleansing
quick_solutions: Avoid irritant wipes and tight diapers
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See clinician if rash persists, worsens, or is associated with fever.

primary_symptoms: itchy, violaceous papules on skin and/or white lacy lesions in the mouth
quick_solutions: Topical steroids for skin lesions, steroid mouthwash for oral involvement
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: See dermatologist if extensive, symptomatic, or oral lesions affecting eating.

top_symptoms.symptom: worse with food (gastric) or relieved by food (duodenal)

primary_symptoms: epigastric pain, nausea, and possible bleeding in severe cases
immediate_advice: Avoid NSAIDs and alcohol; try antacids for symptomatic relief
Seek urgent care for vomiting blood or black stools
quick_solutions: Test and treat H. pylori if present; use proton pump inhibitors
Endoscopy for diagnosis if alarm features or persistent symptoms
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate care for signs of GI bleeding or severe pain.

top_symptoms.symptom: groin bulge that increases with strain

primary_symptoms: painless or painful groin bulge, worse with coughing or straining
immediate_advice: Avoid heavy lifting and seek surgical advice for repair
Seek urgent care for severe pain, irreducible bulge, or signs of obstruction
quick_solutions: Elective surgical repair to prevent incarceration
Watchful waiting for asymptomatic small hernias in some patients
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Urgent if bulge cannot be reduced, severe pain, or systemic signs.

primary_symptoms: intense itching and red, dry, scaly patches often on flexural areas
immediate_advice: Use emollients liberally and avoid known triggers
Cool compresses and avoid hot showers
quick_solutions: Topical corticosteroids for flares; topical calcineurin inhibitors as steroid-sparing

primary_symptoms: male breast tissue enlargement and possible tenderness
immediate_advice: Avoid estrogenic substances and review medications with doctor
Consider camera/photograph for tracking size change
quick_solutions: Address underlying cause, medical therapy in some cases
Surgical reduction for persistent bothersome gynecomastia
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If unilateral hard lump, discharge from nipple, or rapid growth.

immediate_advice: Increase oral fluids and seek evaluation if symptoms are significant
quick_solutions: Urine test and short course of appropriate antibiotics
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If fever, flank pain, vomiting, or symptoms of upper tract infection.

primary_symptoms: target lesions on skin often after infection or drug exposure
immediate_advice: Keep mucosa clean and avoid spicy foods if oral lesions present
quick_solutions: Supportive care and topical steroids for mild cases
Systemic therapy if severe or widespread
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If extensive mucosal involvement, difficulty swallowing, or breathing difficulty.

primary_symptoms: spinal curvature visible as uneven shoulders or hips
immediate_advice: Observe posture and avoid heavy asymmetric loading
Seek orthopedic evaluation for new or progressive deformity
quick_solutions: Observation, bracing for progressive curves in growing children
Surgical correction for severe or progressive curves
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If rapid progression or respiratory difficulty with severe curves.

top_symptoms.symptom: bony bump at base of big toe

primary_symptoms: prominent bump on side of big toe
immediate_advice: Wear wider comfortable shoes and use toe spacers
quick_solutions: Surgical correction (bunionectomy) if conservative measures fail
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If severe pain or trouble walking despite conservative care.

primary_symptoms: palpitations, skipped beats or abnormally fast/slow heart rate
immediate_advice: Stop exertion, sit or lie down and note the pattern of symptoms
Seek urgent care if chest pain, fainting, or severe breathlessness occur
quick_solutions: Medication, cardioversion or electrophysiology intervention depending on type
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If syncope, chest pain, or hemodynamic instability.

primary_symptoms: triggered by chewing or light touch
immediate_advice: Avoid triggers (cold wind, chewing hard foods)
quick_solutions: Surgical options (microvascular decompression, radiofrequency ablation) if refractory
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If pain is persistent, disabling, or unresponsive to medication.

immediate_advice: Maintain regular exercise and posture care
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If worsening spinal stiffness or reduced mobility.
If weakness progresses or interferes with daily activities.
If cyst becomes painful, red, or rapidly enlarges.

immediate_advice: Do not induce vomiting unless advised
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate after suspected overdose.
If symptoms impair work, school, or relationships.

immediate_advice: Seek medical evaluation for urinary changes
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If urinary obstruction or blood in urine occurs.

immediate_advice: Keep patient lying flat with head elevated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate with neurological decline.

immediate_advice: Avoid trying to reduce dislocation yourself
quick_solutions: X-ray and reduction by medical professional
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate if severe pain or deformity after injury.
Immediately for severe swelling, fractures, or breathing issues.

quick_solutions: Pain control and diabetes management if present
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If pain becomes severe or complications arise.

quick_solutions: Surgical drainage if very large or compressing structures
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If hematoma rapidly enlarges or compresses airway/circulation.

quick_solutions: Cryotherapy, curettage, or laser removal if symptomatic
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If rapid growth, bleeding, or irregular appearance.

immediate_advice: Cool burn under running water for 10–20 minutes
quick_solutions: Fluids and hospitalization for severe burns
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If burn is large, deep, or involves face, hands, feet, or genitals.

quick_solutions: Surgical or medical management if incomplete
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate if heavy bleeding or severe pain occurs.

quick_solutions: Pain relief with topical or oral agents
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If frequent or severe recurrences occur.

quick_solutions: Medication for severe anxiety or depression
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms interfere with daily functioning.
If severe abdominal pain or jaundice occurs.

immediate_advice: Maintain regular exercise and balanced diet
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If sudden neurological deficits appear.
If swallowing becomes progressively difficult.
Immediate after trauma with pelvic pain.

immediate_advice: Use protective masks in high-risk occupations
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If progressive breathing difficulty occurs.

immediate_advice: Maintain hydration and avoid NSAIDs during flare
Record stool frequency and any blood
quick_solutions: Mesalamine or other aminosalicylates for mild-moderate disease
Corticosteroids for acute flares; immunomodulators/biologics for maintenance
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If high fever, severe abdominal pain, profuse bleeding, or signs of dehydration.

immediate_advice: Keep the area clean and dry
quick_solutions: Empiric antibiotics guided by urine/urethral swab results
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If high fever, severe pain, pus discharge, or systemic symptoms.

primary_symptoms: may be asymptomatic or cause genital warts
immediate_advice: Avoid sexual activity with visible lesions until treated
quick_solutions: Topical treatments or procedural removal of warts
Cervical screening and follow-up for women
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If rapidly growing warts, bleeding, or abnormal cervical screening.
medical_advice.severity_level: varies (usually mild; oncogenic strains are serious long-term)

primary_symptoms: chest pain or discomfort provoked by exertion or stress
immediate_advice: Stop activity and rest; use sublingual nitrate if prescribed
quick_solutions: Short-acting nitrates for acute relief; beta-blockers, calcium-channel blockers, antiplatelets, and statins for control
Cardiac workup (ECG, stress testing, imaging) to risk-stratify
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If chest pain at rest, prolonged pain, syncope, or associated breathlessness—seek emergency care.

primary_symptoms: acute paralysis or weakness below the level of injury
immediate_advice: Do not move the patient; immobilize the spine and call emergency services immediately
quick_solutions: Emergency spinal immobilization and urgent imaging
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate—any suspected spinal cord injury requires emergency transport.

primary_symptoms: chronic nasal obstruction, hyposmia/anosmia, and rhinorrhea
immediate_advice: Avoid nasal irritants and seek ENT evaluation if persistent
Use saline nasal rinses for symptom relief
quick_solutions: Topical intranasal corticosteroids; short course of oral corticosteroids for large polyps
Endoscopic sinus surgery if medical therapy fails
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If sudden severe congestion, high fever, facial swelling, or vision changes.

primary_symptoms: itch-scratch cycle leading to localized thickened (lichenified) skin
immediate_advice: Avoid scratching and keep area moisturized
Use cool compresses to reduce itch
quick_solutions: Topical high-potency corticosteroids for short periods
Behavioral measures and antihistamines for itch control
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If secondary infection, rapidly spreading lesions, or severe impact on sleep/function.

primary_symptoms: misdirected eyelashes rubbing the cornea causing irritation
immediate_advice: Avoid rubbing eyes and use lubricating drops
quick_solutions: Epilation of offending lashes; permanent solutions include electrolysis or surgical eyelid correction
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If increasing pain, vision changes, or signs of corneal damage.

primary_symptoms: skin infestation symptoms (pruritus, papular rash) commonly due to mites
immediate_advice: Practice good hygiene and wash bedding/linen in hot water
quick_solutions: Topical permethrin or other acaricides as recommended
Oral therapy in severe or crusted cases under medical supervision
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If secondary infection, widespread lesions, or treatment failure.

primary_symptoms: persistent change in bowel habits, rectal bleeding or occult blood, abdominal discomfort, and weight loss
immediate_advice: Do not ignore persistent rectal bleeding or change in bowel habits; seek evaluation
Maintain records of bleeding, stool changes and weight loss
quick_solutions: Staging with CT and multidisciplinary oncologic management (surgery, chemo, radiation as indicated)
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Promptly for persistent bleeding, obstruction symptoms, severe pain, or systemic symptoms.

primary_symptoms: post-surgical pain, swelling/seroma, and temporary reduced shoulder movement
immediate_advice: Follow wound care instructions, keep incision clean and dry, and attend scheduled follow-ups
Begin gentle shoulder exercises as advised by physiotherapy
quick_solutions: Analgesia, wound surveillance, drain care if applicable, physiotherapy to restore range of motion
Report fever, increasing pain, or purulent drainage to surgical team
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If fever, severe increasing pain, redness, or pus from incision, or sudden swelling of arm (possible lymphedema signs).

immediate_advice: Apply cold packs to reduce swelling
quick_solutions: Empiric antibiotics targeted to likely pathogens (e.g., doxycycline for STI-related or fluoroquinolones for enteric organisms) after appropriate testing
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care for severe pain, systemic fever, or suspected testicular torsion (sudden severe pain).

top_symptoms.symptom: sudden gush or continuous leakage of fluid

primary_symptoms: leakage of amniotic fluid before or during labor
immediate_advice: Avoid intercourse and digital vaginal examinations until evaluated
Go to obstetric emergency for assessment
quick_solutions: Assessment: confirm with speculum exam and tests (nitrazine, ferning, ultrasound), monitor for fetal wellbeing and maternal infection
Management depends on gestational age — expectant management, antibiotics, corticosteroids for fetal lung maturity, or delivery if indicated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate evaluation for any suspected membrane rupture, especially with bleeding, fever, or decreased fetal movements.
medical_advice.severity_level: serious (risks include infection and preterm birth)

top_symptoms.symptom: small pearly papules with central dimple

primary_symptoms: multiple flesh-colored, dome-shaped papules with central umbilication
immediate_advice: Avoid scratching and sharing towels or clothing
quick_solutions: Often self-limiting — cryotherapy, curettage, or topical treatments (cantharidin, imiquimod) for persistent lesions
Educate about transmission, especially in children and sexual transmission in adults
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If lesions become painful, infected, numerous, or persist for many months.

primary_symptoms: physiologic increased clear/white vaginal discharge, often cyclical
immediate_advice: Maintain genital hygiene and avoid scented products that can irritate
quick_solutions: Reassurance if no pruritus, odor, or abnormal bleeding; investigate with speculum exam and swabs if symptoms suggest infection
Treat underlying infection if identified (e.g., bacterial vaginosis, trichomonas, candidiasis)
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If discharge is foul-smelling, green/yellow, associated with pain/fever, or has abnormal bleeding.

primary_symptoms: reduced urine flow, sensation of incomplete emptying, or urinary retention
immediate_advice: If unable to pass urine, seek emergency care — urgent catheterization may be required
Avoid attempting to self-catheterize without instruction
quick_solutions: Relieve retention with urethral catheterization, investigate cause (prostatic enlargement, urethral stricture, stones, neurogenic bladder)
Definitive treatment directed at underlying cause (alpha-blockers, surgery, urethral dilatation)
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate for acute urinary retention, severe pain, or rising creatinine/fever.

top_symptoms.symptom: new or changing pigmented skin lesion

primary_symptoms: changing pigmented lesion, irregular borders, color variegation, bleeding, or rapid growth
immediate_advice: Avoid further sun exposure to the lesion and seek dermatologic assessment promptly
quick_solutions: Urgent dermatology referral for excisional biopsy of suspicious lesions, staging if confirmed
Treatment typically surgical excision; oncology referral if advanced
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate evaluation for any suspicious or changing mole; earlier detection improves prognosis.

primary_symptoms: abnormal bleeding or discharge originating from the cervix
immediate_advice: Avoid douching and seek gynecological evaluation
Use sanitary protection and note bleeding patterns
quick_solutions: Speculum exam, Pap smear/HPV testing, and colposcopy-directed biopsy if indicated
Treat infections, polyps, or refer for further management if neoplasia suspected
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If heavy bleeding, postcoital bleeding, or abnormal cytology results — prompt workup required.

top_symptoms.symptom: symptoms of cortisol or aldosterone excess

primary_symptoms: often an incidental adrenal mass; may cause symptoms if hormonally active (Cushing’s, primary aldosteronism, pheochromocytoma features)
immediate_advice: Do not panic — arrange endocrinology evaluation with imaging and hormonal workup
Avoid stopping or starting steroids without medical advice
quick_solutions: Biochemical screening for cortisol, aldosterone/renin ratio, and catecholamine/metanephrine if indicated; adrenal imaging characterization
Surgical removal if functional or suspicious for malignancy
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If new severe hypertension, unexplained weight gain/weakness, or signs of catecholamine excess.
medical_advice.severity_level: varies (usually mild if nonfunctional; serious if functional or malignant)

primary_symptoms: heartburn, retrosternal pain, odynophagia or dysphagia
immediate_advice: Avoid large meals, alcohol, and lying down after eating; try antacids for symptom relief
Seek evaluation if severe odynophagia, bleeding, or weight loss
quick_solutions: Empiric proton-pump inhibitor trial for reflux-related esophagitis; endoscopy for suspected infectious or eosinophilic causes
Treat underlying infection (candida, HSV) if identified
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If inability to swallow saliva, severe pain, hematemesis, or significant weight loss.

primary_symptoms: pruritus, thick white curdy discharge, vulval soreness
immediate_advice: Avoid douching and scented products, use breathable underwear
Do not have intercourse until treated
quick_solutions: Topical azole antifungals (single-dose or short course) or oral fluconazole as per guidelines
Treat partner only if symptomatic; investigate recurrent episodes
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist after treatment, are recurrent, or if unusual bleeding/fever occurs.

top_symptoms.symptom: lower limb weakness or sensory changes

primary_symptoms: neurologic deficits from congenital spinal cord malformation including motor/sensory and urologic dysfunction
immediate_advice: Regular monitoring of urinary tract and skin integrity, protect from pressure sores
Maintain scheduled follow-ups with multidisciplinary team
quick_solutions: Urodynamic assessment and management for bladder dysfunction, orthotic/orthopedic interventions for deformities, physiotherapy and mobility aids
Surgical interventions if tethered cord or other treatable complications
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If progressive weakness, new pain, loss of bladder/bowel control, or signs of infection.

primary_symptoms: symptoms vary by agent — may include GI upset, CNS depression/agitation, arrhythmias, hypotension
immediate_advice: If overdose suspected, seek emergency care immediately; bring medication labels if possible
Do not induce vomiting unless advised by poison control or clinician
quick_solutions: Supportive care, activated charcoal if appropriate and early, specific antidotes where available (e.g., naloxone for opioids, flumazenil in select benzodiazepine cases only under supervision)
Cardiac monitoring and ICU support for severe toxicity
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate for altered consciousness, respiratory depression, seizures, arrhythmias, or hemodynamic instability.

primary_symptoms: range from fatty liver to alcoholic hepatitis to cirrhosis — symptoms include malaise, jaundice, abdominal swelling
immediate_advice: Stop alcohol intake immediately and seek medical advice
Maintain nutrition and avoid hepatotoxic medications
quick_solutions: Assessment with LFTs, ultrasound, and specialist hepatology evaluation; corticosteroids for severe alcoholic hepatitis in select cases; treat complications (ascites, varices, encephalopathy)
Long-term abstinence programs and nutritional support
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If jaundice, confusion, severe abdominal pain, or signs of bleeding develop.

top_symptoms.symptom: very high blood pressure (diastolic often >120 mmHg)

primary_symptoms: extremely elevated blood pressure with evidence of acute target organ damage (retinopathy, encephalopathy, renal impairment)
immediate_advice: This is a medical emergency — seek immediate hospital care
Do not attempt rapid BP reduction at home
quick_solutions: Controlled IV antihypertensive therapy in hospital with monitoring of organ function
Identify and treat secondary causes if present
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate for severe headache, visual loss, seizures, chest pain, or reduced urine output with very high BP.

primary_symptoms: localized lower abdominal pain (classically left-sided), fever, and altered bowel habits
immediate_advice: Avoid solid food until evaluated if severe pain or fever; seek medical assessment
quick_solutions: CT abdomen for diagnosis if complicated; antibiotics and bowel rest for uncomplicated cases; drainage or surgery for abscess/perforation
Colonoscopic evaluation after recovery to rule out malignancy if indicated
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate for severe pain, high fever, persistent vomiting, or signs of peritonitis.

top_symptoms.symptom: recurrent transient ischemic attacks or strokes

primary_symptoms: progressive steno-occlusive disease of intracranial arteries causing ischemic or hemorrhagic events
immediate_advice: Urgent neurological assessment for new focal deficits or TIAs
Avoid dehydration and treat vascular risk factors
quick_solutions: Cerebral angiography for diagnosis and surgical revascularization (bypass procedures) in many cases
Stroke prevention strategies and multidisciplinary care
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: Immediate for new neurological deficits, worsening headaches, or seizures.

primary_symptoms: excessive sweating, weakness, lightheadedness after heat exposure
immediate_advice: Move to a cool place, rest, and sip cool fluids containing electrolytes
Remove extra clothing and spray with water or use fans
quick_solutions: Oral rehydration and cooling measures; seek medical attention if vomiting, confusion, or inability to drink
Monitor for progression to heat stroke (altered mental status, very high temperature)
medical_advice.when_to_seek_help: If high body temperature, confusion, collapse, or if symptoms worsen despite cooling.
medical_advice.severity_level: moderate (can progress to critical heat stroke)
